parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To stand by, be urgent, befall one (as of evil), be at hand, impend. From epi and histemi; to stand upon, i.e. Be present.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
Of Hebrew origin; Saul, the Jewish name of Paul.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To look up, recover my sight. From ana and blepo; to look up; by implication, to recover sight.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: To also, I too, but I. From kai and ego; so also the dative case kamoi, and accusative case kame and I, me.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To look up, recover my sight. From ana and blepo; to look up; by implication, to recover sight.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
